column1: # Mission efficiency effect in combat modifiers.
# Following modifiers are used to define the mission efficiency effect in combats (used as combat modifier) when combat type matches unit's mission.
# There are 3 modifiers for each mission:
# 1. Added - it is added to current mission efficiency for the country owning the unit.
#     It can be negative to limit the combat effect only when mission efficiency is above certain value.
# 2. Min - mission efficiency + Added value (from above) should be at least equal to THIS.
#     Setting this to 0.0 ensures that there will be no combat penalty.
# 3. Combat efficiency multiplier - Used to weight the effect of current mission efficiency (modified by first two modifiers) in the combat.
#     Added combat efficiency = THIS * (Mission efficiency + Added value). Set to 0.0 to give no effect for this mission type in the combat.
# Mission efficiency = 60% (0.6), Added Value = -0.5, Min Value = 0.0, Multiplier = 0.2
# Mission efficiency modifier in combat = (0.6 + (-0.5)) * 0.2 = 0.02 or +2% combat modifier
# Mission efficiency = 40% (0.4), Added Value = -0.5, Min Value = 0.0, Multiplier = 0.2
# Mission efficiency modifier in combat = (0.4 + (-0.5)) * 0.2 = 0.0 (or no combat modifier)
#  because (0.4 + (-0.5)) = -0.1 which is less then Min Value, so Min Value (0.0) is used instead
### Fleet Attack on Port (Carrier vs. Port)
